cloudKit.title: iCloud
cloudKit.description: Synchronize your notifications and buckets with iCloud to keep them in sync across your Apple devices. Sync is required to have notifications available on Apple Watch.

cloudKit.resyncError: Failed to resync CloudKit. Please try again.

watchSyncMode.title: Subscription Sync Mode
watchSyncMode.description: Control how the Watch app receives CloudKit updates. This affects battery life and data freshness.
watchSyncMode.foregroundOnlyDescription: Subscriptions active only while the Watch app is open. Best battery life.
watchSyncMode.alwaysActiveDescription: Subscriptions always active, even in background. Real-time updates but higher battery usage.
watchSyncMode.backgroundIntervalDescription: Periodic background sync every ~15 minutes. Balanced battery life and data freshness.
watchSyncMode.updateSuccess: Subscription sync mode updated. Open the Watch app to apply the change.
watchSyncMode.updateError: Failed to update subscription sync mode. Please try again.

common.pushPermissionsHint: Check notification settings for Zentik and enable alerts
common.pushPermissionsDetails: Notifications permission was denied. To enable push notifications, you may need to uninstall and reinstall the app, then allow notifications when prompted. On iOS: delete the app and reinstall from TestFlight/App Store. On Android: long-press the app > App info > Notifications, or reinstall the app.
common.pushNeedsPwaHint: To enable push notifications on the web, add Zentik as an app from your browser (Install App / Add to Home Screen), then reopen it.
common.pushNeedsPwaDetails:
To receive push notifications on the web, install Zentik as an app (PWA) and then reopen it.

How to install:
- Chrome/Edge (Windows/Linux): Menu > Install Zentik (or 'Install app').
- Chrome (Android): Menu ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ > Add to Home screen.
- Safari (iOS/iPadOS): Share button > Add to Home Screen.
- Safari (macOS): File > Add to Dock.

After installation, open Zentik from the new icon and sign in if requested.
common.filesystemPermissionDetails: The app cannot access device storage. Media thumbnails and bucket icons will not be generated. Please check app permissions in your device settings and restart the app.

userSettings.GithubEventsFilter_description: Comma-separated list of GitHub events to allow (e.g., push,pull_request,issues). You can also use special handlers: ALL_SUCCESS (only success events) and ALL_FAILURE (only failure events). All other events will be filtered out.

welcome.title: Welcome to Zentik!
welcome.description: We'll guide you through the first steps to start using Zentik to manage your notifications.
welcome.description2: The application allows you to collect notifications from different systems and in different ways. You can create a "Bucket" for each system you want to track. Later you will be able to send a notification to your bucket by authenticating with an access token

bucket.title: Create your first bucket
bucket.description: Buckets allow you to organize your notifications by category. Let's create your first bucket together.

token.title: Generate an access token
token.description: Access tokens allow you to send notifications via the REST API. Let's generate a token for you.

notification.title: Send your first notification
notification.description: Now we'll send a test notification to verify that everything works correctly.

api.title: Use the REST API
api.description: Here's how you can send notifications via the REST API using the generated token.
api.documentationInfo: Detailed information on how to send notifications at this link:

messages.bucketCreateError: Unable to create bucket. Please try again.
messages.tokenCreateError: Unable to create token. Please try again.
messages.notificationSendError: Unable to send notification. Please try again.
messages.bucketNameRequired: Enter a name for the bucket
messages.tokenNameRequired: Enter a name for the token
messages.tokenCopied: Your access token has been created and copied to clipboard:
messages.useInHeader: Use it in the Authorization header: Bearer

sqlite.description: Backup and restore the SQLite database

sqliteBackup.webNotSupported: Database backup is only available on mobile platforms

sqliteRestore.latestBackupNotFound: No local automatic backup found yet.
sqliteRestore.latestBackupConfirmMessage: This will replace your current database with the latest automatic local backup. All current data will be lost. Are you sure?
sqliteRestore.confirmMessage: This will replace your current database with the backup file. All current data will be lost. Are you sure?
sqliteRestore.successMessage: Database restored successfully. Please refresh the app.
sqliteRestore.latestBackupSuccessMessage: Database restored from latest local backup ({{name}}).
sqliteRestore.webNotSupported: Database restore is only available on mobile platforms

sqliteReset.confirmMessage: This will completely delete the database and all its data. The database will be recreated from scratch on next app launch. This action cannot be undone. Are you sure?
sqliteReset.successMessage: Database has been reset. The app will recreate it on next launch.
sqliteReset.webNotSupported: Database reset is only available on mobile platforms

databaseBackup.title: Database Backup
databaseBackup.description: Export and import SQLite database backup files
databaseBackup.importWarning: This will replace all current data

resetDatabase.title: Reset Database
resetDatabase.warningMessage:
This will delete the local SQLite database and force a complete re-download of all notifications and buckets from the server. This operation cannot be undone.

Are you sure?
resetDatabase.description: Delete SQLite database and re-download all data from server
resetDatabase.successMessage: Database deleted successfully. The app will now re-download all data from the server.

step1.title: Welcome to Zentik
step1.description:
A powerful notification management system that helps you organize and control your notifications.

You can connect to your personal self-hosted server by enabling the checkbox below and entering your server URL.
step1.createExternalSystem: Create an external system (e.g. ntfy, Gotify)

step2.title: Customize Your Experience
step2.description: Configure the appearance and behavior of the app according to your preferences.
step2.markAsReadModeDescription: Select when notifications should be marked as read.
step2.pushNotificationsDescription: Configure how push notifications behave by default.
step2.disclaimer: All these settings can be modified at any time in the App Settings section.

step3.title: Data Management and Downloads
step3.description: Configure how data is stored and automatic downloads are handled.
step3.retentionPresetDescription: Choose how long to keep notifications and media on your device.

low.name: Low Retention
low.description: Keeps only recent data to save space. Ideal for devices with limited storage.

balanced.name: Balanced
balanced.description: Recommended for most users. Balances data retention and available space.

longer.name: Extended Retention
longer.description: Keeps data longer for extended access to history. Requires more storage space.

custom.name: Custom
custom.description: Manually configure retention policies according to your specific needs.

step3.autoDownloadDescription: Configure how media attachments are downloaded.
step3.enableAutoDownloadDescription: Automatically download all media attachments from notifications.
step3.wifiOnlyDescription: Limit automatic downloads when connected to WiFi to save mobile data.
step3.disclaimer: All these settings can be modified at any time in the App Settings section.

step4.title: Buckets and Access Tokens
step4.description: Configure your first bucket to organize notifications and create an access token for the API.
step4.deviceNotRegisteredDescription: Your device is not yet registered to receive push notifications. Register it now to continue.
step4.selectBucketDescription: Buckets help you organize your notifications. Select an existing bucket or create a new one.
step4.noBuckets: You don't have any buckets yet. Create your first bucket to get started.
step4.createTokenDescription: Generate an access token to allow your applications to send notifications to the selected bucket.
step4.tokenWillBeCreated: A new token will be automatically created for this bucket
step4.tokenHint: Save this token in a secure location. It won't be visible again after closing this screen.
step4.tokenSelectedHint: This token has been selected for use with the bucket.
step4.noTokensAvailable: No tokens available for this bucket
step4.disclaimer: You can manage buckets and tokens at any time from the Settings section.
step4.completeSetupWarning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Complete bucket and token configuration to continue
step4.magicCodeWarning: Your bucket includes a magic code for easy unauthenticated access. While convenient, this bypasses authentication. For enhanced security, consider using an access token instead, which you can create at any time from the bucket settings.

step5.title: Test Notification
step5.description: Send a test notification to verify everything works correctly.
step5.defaultBody: This is a test notification from Zentik!
step5.sendSuccess: ‚úÖ Notification sent successfully! You should receive it shortly.
step5.sendError: ‚ùå Error sending notification. Check the token and try again.
step5.missingTokenOrBucket: ‚ùå Missing token or bucket. Go back to Step 4 to generate the token.
step5.missingFields: ‚ùå Fill in all fields before sending.
step5.info: You should receive a notification shortly. If you don't receive it, check your device's notification settings.
step5.docsDescription: Check the official documentation to configure notifications with this template.

step6.title: All Set!
step6.description: Setup is complete. Here is the information to integrate Zentik into your application.
step6.completionMessage: You have successfully completed the setup of Zentik. You can now start receiving notifications from your applications!
step6.documentationDescription: Discover all advanced features, integration examples and best practices.

shareExtension.notAuthenticated: Not authenticated. Please log in to the main app first.
shareExtension.noBucketsHelper: Create a bucket in the main app first.
shareExtension.loginRequired: Open the Zentik app and log in to use the Share Extension.

errors.notAuthenticated: Not authenticated. Please log in to the main app first.

databaseRecovery.title: Database Corruption Detected
databaseRecovery.description: The database appears to be corrupted. You can attempt to recover your data from the current database before resetting it.
databaseRecovery.choiceDescription: The database appears to be corrupted. Choose how to recover.
databaseRecovery.warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: If recovery fails, you may lose your local data. Make sure you have a backup or that your data is synced with the server.
databaseRecovery.iCloudOnlyOnIOS: iCloud recovery is only available on iOS.

notFound.title: Page Not Found
notFound.description: The page you're looking for doesn't exist or has been moved.
